caption:
On this day 61 years ago, Malcolm X delivered his iconic 'Ballot or the Bullet' speech in Cleveland, Ohio, on April 3, 1964. 🔥 His message was clear: Black Americans must use their political power strategically and demand their civil rights.⁠
⁠
🗳️ 'The time has come for Black people to fight back in self-defense whenever and wherever they are unjustly and unlawfully attacked.'⁠
⁠
💡 He challenged systemic oppression and called for unity beyond religious or ideological differences, stating:⁠
"Whether you are a Christian or a Muslim or a nationalist, we all have the same problem. They don’t hang you because you're a Baptist; they hang you because you’re Black!"⁠
⁠
📢 Malcolm X urged the Black community to use the ballot wisely. Demand real change from politicians or refuse to support those who don’t serve Black interests. His message remains as relevant today as it was in 1964.⁠
⁠
✊🏾 Do you think his words still apply today? Drop your thoughts in the comments! 👇🏾⁠
